snippet: Pro-Russian militias commandeered vehicles from the Ukrainian Army as a military operation by the Kiev government in the eastern part of the nation fell apart.
abstract: Ukraine's military operation to confront pro-Russian militants in country's east unravels in disarray, with the entire contingent of 21 armored vehicles surrendering or pulling back before nightfall; events underscore weakness of new government in Kiev, as officials increasingly seem powerless to contain growing rebellion by pro-Russian militants that has spread to at least nine cities in eastern Ukraine.

byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins contributed reporting from Kiev, Ukraine, and C. J. Chivers from the United States.

lead_paragraph: Pro-Russian militias commandeered vehicles from the Ukrainian Army as a military operation by the Kiev government in the eastern part of the nation fell apart.

headline.main: Ukraine Push Against Rebels Grinds to Halt
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Push Against Rebels Grinds to Halt
